channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Former Vice President Dick Cheney dies. And, Election Day races to watch
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney has died at age 84. And, today, voters in New York, Virginia and New Jersey choose new leaders in key races.
item.content:encoded:
Former Vice President Dick Cheney has died at age 84. And, today, voters in New York, Virginia and New Jersey choose new leaders in key races.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Meet the Austrian nuns who fled a care home to break into their old convent
item.description: Octogenarian Sisters Rita, Regina and Bernadette went back to their old convent with local support, and an Instagram following. "People are calling us the rebellious sisters!" Rita says.
item.content:encoded:
Octogenarian Sisters Rita, Regina and Bernadette went back to their old convent with local support, and an Instagram following. "People are calling us the rebellious sisters!" Rita says.

(Image credit: Joe Klamar)
item.dc:creator: Esme Nicholson

item.title: Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful vice presidents in American history, dies at 84
item.description: Cheney, who extolled the power of the presidency, died Monday, according to a statement from his family. The cause was complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.
item.content:encoded:
Cheney, who extolled the power of the presidency, died Monday, according to a statement from his family. The cause was complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.

(Image credit: Charles Dharapak)
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: A Planet Money Guide To Five Fascinating Economic Studies
item.description: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economic studies.
item.content:encoded: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economic studies.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: When SNAP benefits will arrive is still in flux. Here's what communities are doing to fill the gap
item.description: Reporters from the NPR Network are covering the uncertainty and lapse in benefits in states across the country.
item.content:encoded:
Reporters from the NPR Network are covering the uncertainty and lapse in benefits in states across the country.

(Image credit: Eli Imadali)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: Searching 'weight' can bring up Ozempic in results. It's a drug advertising loophole
item.description: There are strict rules about what drug companies can say in TV or print ads. But a new study shows there's a lot more wiggle room when companies pay to sponsor online search results.
item.content:encoded: There are strict rules about what drug companies can say in TV or print ads. But a new study shows there's a lot more wiggle room when companies pay to sponsor online search results.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: How one tech startup is giving cash to SNAP recipients
item.description: Propel makes a free app for people on food stamps. Now it's giving some of them $50 each, as some private companies, nonprofits, and individuals scramble to help.
item.content:encoded:
Propel makes a free app for people on food stamps. Now it's giving some of them $50 each, as some private companies, nonprofits, and individuals scramble to help.

(Image credit: Sharnette Collins)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: From California to NYC: 4 races to watch this Election Day
item.description: Four races highlight this year's elections: a redistricting referendum in California, governor's races in New Jersey and Virginia and the mayoral contest in New York City.
item.content:encoded:
Four races highlight this year's elections: a redistricting referendum in California, governor's races in New Jersey and Virginia and the mayoral contest in New York City.

(Image credit: Gabriella Angotti-Jones for NPR)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: The Dalai Lama created a Tibetan capital in exile in India. It's shrinking
item.description: For decades, Tibetans built a capital in exile in Dharamshala, India, and sent their kids to a school founded by the Dalai Lama. That's now changing.
item.content:encoded:
For decades, Tibetans built a capital in exile in Dharamshala, India, and sent their kids to a school founded by the Dalai Lama. That's now changing.

(Image credit: Diaa Hadid)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Israel rocked by scandal as top military lawyer is thrown into jail
item.description: A political scandal has erupted over allegations of severe abuses of Palestinians. A military official, who had leaked a video, disappeared briefly on Sunday. She was found later and is now being held in prison.
item.content:encoded:
A political scandal has erupted over allegations of severe abuses of Palestinians. A military official, who had leaked a video, disappeared briefly on Sunday. She was found later and is now being held in prison.

(Image credit: Oren Ben Hakoon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
